Superordinate (i.e. more generic). The generic term used to designate a whole class of specific instances.
X is a hypernym of Y
Y is a (kind of) X (nouns)
to Y is to X in some particular manner (verbs)
oak tree an oak is a kind of tree
tree plant a tree is a kind of plant
house dwelling a house is a kind of dwelling
disappointment disatisfaction disappointment is a kind of disatisfaction
amble walk to amble is to walk in some manner
march walk to march is to walk in some manner
lisp say to lisp is to say in some manner
slam hit to slam is to hit in some manner
